intro: Commicarpus boissieri, commonly known as the Kashmir Himalayan thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and thorny stems. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its fruit is a dry, capsule-like structure that contains several seeds. Commicarpus boissieri is valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soil in mountainous regions.
